intro.subtitle: With this Great Opening of Material, let there be a Great Opening of Spirit.

items.title: Tai Chi at the Mechanicsville Library
items.description: Join us at the Tai Chi is meditation in movement. Its soft movements create flows of energy that cultivate your physical and inner strength. In this class, learn about the energy of Yin and Yang to bring health, stability and vitality into your life. Friendly for all ages.

items.title: Breathing Meditation
items.description: Breathing Meditation focuses on balancing the body and mind by following the breath. Every moment of every day, we rely on our breath, but few of us know how their breath affects them and how to breathe mindfully. In this class, learn to accumulate and cultivate your Qi energy.

items.title: Mindfulness Meditation
items.description: Mindfulness Meditation helps cultivate a peace of mind and increases your ability to handle stressful situations. In this class, you will not only learn how to let go of worries while practicing your sitting meditation, but also how to create a balance of life in every waking momvent.

items.title: Tai Chi
items.description: Tai Chi is meditation in movement. Its soft movements create flows of energy that cultivate your physical and inner strength. In this class, learn about the energy of Yin and Yang to bring health, stability and vitality into your life. Friendly for all ages.

items.title: Group Meditation
items.description: This morning group meditation is based on the Mindfulness Meditation above, but is enhanced by the mornings silent universal energies. The freshness cultivated in this mindful morning practice will last all day.

items.title: Won Buddhism Korean Service
items.description: Attend our traditional weekly Won Buddhist Service where we practice chanting, pray for world peace, read the Scriptures, perform Dharma talks, reflect on our past weeks graces and trials, and practice silent meditation together.

items.title: 2nd Annual Youngsan Stay in Korea
items.description: Enjoy a month long retreat in the peaceful and sacred space of Youngsan, protected by the busy city life, intended to allow participants to quiet the mind and open the heart while learning deeply the principles of Won Buddhism.

about.title: About Our Temple
about_paragraphs: Welcome to the Won Buddhism Temple of Richmond. Won Buddhism of Richmond has served since 1999, as a spiritual home for Richmond. It is a place of peace and restoration, and a place to learn and practice Won Buddhism and meditation. We welcome everyone who wants to cultivate inner peace, joy and wisdom.
No experience is necessary. There are no fees for our programs, however, the temple is fully self-supporting and any level of donations are much appreciated. Please join us!
about.subtitle: About Won-Buddhism
about_won_paragraphs: Won-Buddhism, a reformed and modernized Buddhism, teaches us how to use our minds. To use the mind well, we should first know what the mind is like and how it works. Based on that understanding, we should cultivate and use it skillfully in everyday situations.
Whether a one-hundred dollar bill is crisp or crumpled, it has the same value. Our original mind is pure, bright, and wholesome, lacking nothing.
Everyone has a mind and is constantly using it.
